title: Bad Bunny Announces New Album Debí Tirar Más Fotos
description: The Puerto Rican superstar’s follow-up to Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Mañana releases January 5
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The Puerto Rican superstar’s follow-up to Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Mañana releases January 5
text: The Puerto Rican superstar’s follow-up to Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Mañana releases January 5Bad Bunny has announced a new album. Debí Tirar Más Fotos (which, in English, is “I Should Have Taken More Photos”) is the Puerto Rican superstar’s follow-up to last year’s Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Mañana and is out January 5. Bad Bunny shared the news today (December 26) by posting a teaser video, featuring Puerto Rican filmmaker Jacobo Morales, to his Instagram. He also dropped the single “Pitorro de Coco,” which was produced by Mag, Tainy, and La Paciencia. Check out the new song below.The 17-track Debí Tirar Más Fotos will feature “Pitorro de Coco” and the previously released “El Clúb.” This year, Bad Bunny has continued to be an outspoken activist for his home island, sharing the song “Una Velita,” which reflected on Hurricane Maria’s devastating aftermath in the Caribbean, and releasing an eight-minute tribute video to Puerto Rico after a speaker at U.S. President-elect Donald J. Trump’s Madison Square Garden rally referred to it as an “island of garbage.” He’s also been furthering his acting career, and is set to appear in Adam Sandler’s Happy Gilmore 2 and a forthcoming film from Darren Aronofsky. Find a new Happy Gilmore 2 teaser video below.Read more about Bad Bunny in Pitchfork’s lists of “The 100 Best Songs of the 2020s So Far” and “The 100 Best Albums of the 2020s So Far.”
html:
The Puerto Rican superstar’s follow-up to Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Mañana releases January 5

Bad Bunny has announced a new album. Debí Tirar Más Fotos (which, in English, is “I Should Have Taken More Photos”) is the Puerto Rican superstar’s follow-up to last year’s Nadie Sabe Lo Que Va a Pasar Mañana and is out January 5. Bad Bunny shared the news today (December 26) by posting a teaser video, featuring Puerto Rican filmmaker Jacobo Morales, to his Instagram. He also dropped the single “Pitorro de Coco,” which was produced by Mag, Tainy, and La Paciencia. Check out the new song below.

The 17-track Debí Tirar Más Fotos will feature “Pitorro de Coco” and the previously released “El Clúb.” This year, Bad Bunny has continued to be an outspoken activist for his home island, sharing the song “Una Velita,” which reflected on Hurricane Maria’s devastating aftermath in the Caribbean, and releasing an eight-minute tribute video to Puerto Rico after a speaker at U.S. President-elect Donald J. Trump’s Madison Square Garden rally referred to it as an “island of garbage.” He’s also been furthering his acting career, and is set to appear in Adam Sandler’s Happy Gilmore 2 and a forthcoming film from Darren Aronofsky. Find a new Happy Gilmore 2 teaser video below.

Read more about Bad Bunny in Pitchfork’s lists of “The 100 Best Songs of the 2020s So Far” and “The 100 Best Albums of the 2020s So Far.”
